sense.name: perceive/view by sight
sense.commentary: Note: This refers to input (as if) through the eyes.
sense.examples: Can you see the bird in that tree? His fumbling the ball was seen on TV by millions of viewers. The camera saw the burglary and recorded it. I must see your passport before you can enter the country. Don't drive after taking the medication. It will make you see double. They are planning to see two museums tomorrow.

sense.name: perceive or understand mentally
sense.commentary: Note: Includes perceiving through imagination, experiencing, observing.
sense.examples: I just can't see your point. They saw a risk in his strategy. I am not seeing this situation as hopeless. I see what you mean. Did you see any encouragement from him? You'll see a lot of cheating in this school. He saw action in Vietnam. I see that you have been promoted. I saw Berlin before the Wall came down. 1960 saw the rebellion of the younger generation against established traditions. As an artist, you must learn to see.

sense.name: verify, prove, check or insure by actively examining (evidence)
sense.examples: He's going to see whether the train will leave on time. See whether you can come tomorrow. He went to see if the valves were indeed closed. Let's see.

sense.name: take care of, take responsilibity, escort
sense.examples: Can you see about this matter at once? Jeff's job is to see to it that the visitors get the proper reception. Jeeves will see you to the door. The sponsor has promised us to see the project to completion. See to it!

sense.name: meet or encounter socially or professionally
sense.examples: How nice to see you again! He's been seeing a therapist for two years. She hasn't seen her mother in six months. The doctor will see you now. His wife thinks he's seeing another woman.

sense.name: match as in poker game
sense.examples: I'll see you and raise you ten.

sense.name: multi-word expressions
sense.commentary: Includes: SEE RED, SEE THE LIGHT, SEE EYE TO EYE Note: This sense includes multi-word expressions and not phrasal verbs. These are colloquial.
sense.examples: When I saw that man hit my mother, I saw red. The lazy student finally saw the light. We never saw eye to eye on this question.
